description: Variation of condition 2 (approved plans), condition 3 (materials), condition 4 (cycle parking), condition 8 (landscaping), condition 13 (ground investigation), condition 14 (remedication scheme), condition 16 (japanese knotweed), condition 17 (Environment Agency access) and condition 18 (flooding) of planning permission ref PP/2015/1906 dated 29/02/2016 for 'Construction of part two storey, part three storey warehouse and showroom (sui genuis) comprising 3,157sqm of floorspace (following the demolition of the existing two storey showroom) including the provision of on-site servicing, cycle parking, 9 no. car parking spaces and associated landscaping'. Amendments to provide for internal and external alterations to the approved building including amended internal layout; alteration to openings, materials and roof panels; reduction in height and clarification on floorspace; relocation of bin store and car parking spaces; incorporation of bin store, landscaping, gates and bollards and amendment of conditions 3, 4, 8, 13, 14, 16, 17 and 18 from details conditions to prescriptive conditions
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission PP/2015/1906 dated 29/02/2016.
REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

2. The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) A101, A102, A103,  A104E, A105A, A106A, A107A, A108A, A109A, A110A, A111A, A112A, A113A, A114A and Stoneworld Construction Management Statement dated 30/03/2015.
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
3. Materials used in the construction of the development shall be in accordance with the details indicated on the approved drawings.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015).
4. The cycle parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be implemented and made available prior to first occupation of the development and permanently retained thereafter.

REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site in accordance policy 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 (f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policies 6.9 of The London Plan 2015.
5. Notwithstanding the approved plans, at least two of the car parking spaces shall provide electric vehicle charging points prior to the first occupation of the development.

REASON: To encourage the uptake of electric vehicles, in accordance with Ealing local  variation to London Plan policy 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policy 1.2 (k) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2015.

6. Details of a Delivery and Servicing Plan (DSP) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development. The details shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter.

REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for access to the site, manoeuvring within the site, and parking in accordance with policiess 6.3 and 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 1.1 (f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015).
7. The delivery vehicles entering the site shall be restricted to 16 tonnes.

REASON: To safegaurd highway users and to ensure that there is adequate provision for access to the site, manoeuvring within the site, and parking in accordance with policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 1.1 (f)of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015).

8. Hard and soft landscape works, boundary treatment, planting and surface finishes shall be in accordance with the details shown on the approved plans. These works shall be carried out as approved prior to the first operation of the use.  Any plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (i) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policies 5.10 and 5.11 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 2.18 and 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

9. All external lighting for the development shall comply with ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011; CIBSE/SLL - FF7 Environmental Considerations for Exterior Lighting and CIBSE/SLL - LG6 Lighting Guide - Outdoor Lighting.

REASON: To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with policy 7.6 of the adopted London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

10. Notwithstanding the Energy Statement prepared by Maven Sustainability in 31st March 2015, prior to the commencement of the development, a report, which includes full details and drawings of the energy and sustainability measures that are to be incorporated into the development, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The submitted details shall demonstrate that the development hereby approved will achieve an overall minimum reduction in regulated carbon dioxide emissions by 35% beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013. Within 3 months of occupation of the warehouse and showroom, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's] and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.

REASON:  To secure the measures set out within the approved Energy Statement and Code for Sustainable Homes Pre-Assessment and to ensure that the energy efficiency measures to be incorporated into the approved development contribute to reducing the use of fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015 (with REMA 2013), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

11. The approved development shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Very Good standard (based on BREEAM 2014 Technical Guidance). Within three months of the commencement of the development, the following should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval: a) Evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the BREEAM 2014 New Construction Scheme b) Interim BREEAM 2014 NC Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE for the relevant part of the development.   Within 3 months from the date of first occupation, a BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' and related Certification verified by the BRE for the relevant part of the development shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented:  Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the relevant part of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.

REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

12. Refuse storage shall be provided on site in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the commencement of the development and retained permanently.

Reason:  To protect amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2015) policy 5.16.
13. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Phase I and Phase II ground investigation reports (Ref: 1433/GIR and 1433/GIR/Rev1.02 respectively).

REASON: To ensure the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy1.1 (j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.
14. The development should be carried out in accordance with the remediation scheme set out in the Phase II Ground Investigation Report (Ref: 14333/GUIR/Rev1.02).

REASON: To ensure the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy1.1 (j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

15. Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced, and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

REASON: To ensure the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy1.1 (j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

16. The removal of Japanese Knotweed along the edge of the River Brent shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained within the Japanese Knotweed Method Statement by Japanese Knotweed Limited dated 7 April 2016.

REASON: To protect and enhance the ecological value of the river corridor in accordance with policies 5.12 and 7.19 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.
17. Access to the River Brent for Environment Agency staff shall be maintained via the gate at the north-west corner of the building for the lifetime of the development.

REASON: To protect the site from flooding by ensuring that the Environment Agency are able to inspect the flood defences behind the site in accordance with policy 1.2 (m) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), and policy 5.12 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

18. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained within the Flood Risk Assessment by GTA dated 13th November 2015 and the Flood Resilient Measures letter by Ardent Consulting Engineers dated 13 May 2016.

REASON: To ensure that safe access and egress from the site can be achieved during a flood in accordance with policy 1.2 (m) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), and policy 5.12 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

19. Vibration from demolition, breaking of concrete and piling etc., as measured in the vertical direction on any floor in surrounding noise sensitive buildings, shall not exceed an overall peak particle velocity level of 1mm/s.

REASON: To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with policy 7.15 of the adopted London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

20. Within 3 months of occupation of the development, a travel plan designed to manage the transport needs of staff and visitors, to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented once approved and shall be permanently retained in operation for the life of the development.
REASON: To limit the impact of the proposal on the highway network in accordance with policies, 6.3 6.11 and 6.12 the London Plan 2015.
